description: Salmon are anadromous fish that migrate from the ocean to freshwater to spawn, important ecologically and commercially.
They feed on invertebrates and smaller fish during different life stages.
Sharks are cartilaginous fish with diverse forms, occupying many marine ecological niches as predators and scavengers.
They feed on fish, marine mammals, invertebrates and carrion depending on species.
Swans are large waterfowl with long necks and graceful appearance, often found on lakes and rivers.
They feed on aquatic vegetation and small aquatic organisms.
Seals are marine mammals adapted to aquatic life with flippers and insulating blubber, feeding on fish and invertebrates.
They haul out on shores or ice to rest and breed.
Squirrels are small to medium-sized rodents with bushy tails, many species are arboreal and feed on nuts and seeds.
They are important seed dispersers in many ecosystems.
